**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-27T09:30:27Z" title="04/27/2015 09:30  AM" data-short="9 yr">April 27, 2015</time> by MalfunctionM1Ke**

I think it can be a reasonable position to say you love the game but it is missing basic features that should be in a first release version. You could also be validated in saying the time between alpha and release was far too short, shockingly so. Some would be valid in having suspicion as SQUAD have said things will or will not be in the game and have reversed their position on a few topics for apparently no reason in the past. This could cause concern about their statement to continue active development.

Myself I will wait and see.

My opinion is that it has been shown by the makers of EVE and Scatterer that the game can be made much more beautiful without a great performance hit. The makers of KER and Mechjeb have shown how information screens can show a wide range of information and the makers of RPM, Vessel viewer, ship effects etc have shown what is possible in IVA.

If the stock game had a lot of the features from those mods I reckon it would be more valid to call it finished feature wise.

The actual 'game' part though, being career with the goals and mechanics involved might need more work, it might be better in 1.0, I'll see later.

> 
> TLDR, 
> Squad: "We baked you a cake!"
> 
> Community: "WHERE IS DA HYPERFANCY CREAM WE ASKED FOR?????"

I think you meant.

Squad: "We will make you an awesome cake with hyperfancy cream".

Community: "MMMmmm this cake mix is delicious"

Squad : "I baked you a cake with hyperfancy cream minus the hyperfancy cream".

Community: Where is DA hyperfancy cream you told me about?".

Squad: "Oh we will get to that later".

Community: "Ok, well is it ok if we just call this a cake then?".

Squad: "No, we are still calling it a cake with hyperfancy cream".

> 
> If KSP is such a bad game, why are you still playing it?

Probably because it's the closest thing we have to "the perfect physics space game", it's a genre that is so starved of titles it needs medical attention, with the only other notable games being just eye candy extravaganzas (space engine) or so dry the sahara desert says "that's pretty dry" (Orbiter).

KSP with addons is closer to their ideal, but the core game is still a bit "lite" and they feel it appeals more to the casual end with only nods to basic physics than the guys like regex and romanstatuehead r4pt0r would prefer, so they and others feel a bit disappointed, and they are sure *others* would like a KSP in the way they wish it was, if only it existed.

I understand their disappointment and can see that gaping hole in gaming for a fun space sim that actually teaches people real world physics.
